message: there are many disabled/foreign students keen to learn python from pycon videos, is there any chance to added subtitle supports?
It may be interesting to see if that toolset can be used after the pycon videos are ready online
There is a very interesting Mozilla Drumbeat project that does something like what you want - http://universalsubtitles.org/en/
Doesn't YouTube also have a feature to do this automatically?

@bear thanks for the link, it still needs volunteer which is fluent in English to write subtitle anyway  @bob , the result of YouTube's automatical speech to text at the moment is not very satisfactory

We can look into it; however the big problem we face with the videos is that the recording and audio visual costs alone are very high. Adding to these costs make it a choice between dropping recording entirely, or somehow digging up additional sponsorship and funds to fund the effort
@jessenoller I appreciate that this is quite a burden, and the main beneficiaries will be those with weak English.
@jessenoller would it be possible to crowdsource subtitles somehow? maybe have humans improve upon a baseline automatic translation?
The Python Miro Community is considering adding universal subtitling, which will allow subtitles ib differing languages.
what @holdenweb said - but that's a PSF/monetary thing and outside the purview of PyCon directly.
